gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਚੋਅਾ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਅੳੁ ਧਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਬੇਚਨ ਕੳੁ ਪੂਰਬਿ ਦਿਸਾ ਲੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈਸੇ ਬਨਿ ਅਾਵੈ ਜੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Choaa Chandanu Au Dhaan Paan Baychan Kau , Poorabi Disaa Lai Jaai Kaisay Bani Aavai Jee ?
translation: Just as someone takes the products grown in the East like rice, betel, sandalwood to sell there, he cannot gain anything in their trading.

gurmukhi: ਪਛਮ ਦਿਸਾ ਦਾਖ ਦਾਰਮ ਲੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਮਦ ਕੇਸੁਰ ਲੈ ੳੁਤਰਹਿ ਧਾਵੈ ਜੀ
transliteration: Pachham Disaa Daakh Daaram Lai Jaai Jaisay , Mrig Mad Kaysur Lai Outarahi Dhaavai Jee ?
translation: Just as someone takes the products grown in the West like grapes and pomegranates, and those commodities grown in the North like saffron and musk to the West and North respectively, what gain does he get out of such trading?

gurmukhi: ਦਖਨ ਦਿਸਾ ਲੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਲਾੲਿਚੀ ਲਵੰਗ ਲਾਦਿ ਬਾਦਿ ਅਾਸਾ ੳੁਦਮ ਹੈ ਬਿੜਤੋ ਨ ਪਾਵੈ ਜੀ
transliteration: Dakhan Disaa Lai Jaai Laaichee Lavang Laadi , Baadi Aasaa Udam Hai Birhato N Paavai Jee ?
translation: Just as someone takes commodities like cardamom and clove to South where these are grown, all his efforts of earning any profit would be futile.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਨ ਨਿਧਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਾਗਰ ਕੈ ਬਿਦਿਮਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਨ ਪ੍ਰਗਟਿ ਕੈ ਬਾਵਰੋ ਕਹਾਵੈ ਜੀ ||੫੧੧||
transliteration: Taisay Goun Nidhi Gur Saagar Kai Bidimaana , Giaan Goun Pragati Kai Baavaro Kahaavai Jee ?511?
translation: Similarly if someone tries to display his traits and knowledge before the True Guru who Himself is ocean of knowledge and divine traits, such a person will be called a fool.  (511)
